You can write your own decideRules that subclass the DecideRule, and you
ov=
erwrite the decisionFor(Object o) method. In the decisionFor(Object o) you
=
check if the Object is a CrawlURI, if so you typecast into CrawlURI and the=
n
you will be able to check the contenttype and content size (look at Crawl=
URI
API). And you can issue decesion REJECT for the uris that don't fulfill=
 you
criteria.

You can also do this by adding a processor, where -in your =
overwriting of
innerProcess(CrawlURI curi)- you check the type and size and=
 then you reject
those URIs you don't want to process by calling curi.s
kip=
ToProcessorChain(getCrawlController().getPostProcessorChain())

beware that=
 DecideRules/Filter inserted before the extraction will prevent
the CrawlJo=
b from ever getting to Uris that are acceptable, because the path
to them g=
oes through URIs that are not.

Anas

s that reject resources based on two conditions:
> content-length and conte=
nt-type (e.g., text/html resources larger than 10MB,

rces larger than 100KB), but I can't find any way to

ubsets together.

e what I want? Should

r patience with a newbie),

Content-Type: text/html; charset=windows-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

You can write your own decideRules that subclass the DecideRule, and you ov=
erwrite the decisionFor(Object o) method. In the decisionFor(Object o) you =
check if the Object is a CrawlURI, if so you typecast into CrawlURI and the=
n you will be able to check the contenttype and content size (look at Crawl=
URI API). And you can issue decesion REJECT for the uris that don't ful=
fill you criteria.<div>
<br></div><div>You can also do this by adding a pro=
cessor, where -in your overwriting of innerProcess(CrawlURI curi)- you chec=
k the type and size and then you reject those URIs you don't want to pr=
ocess by calling curi.s<span class=3D"Apple-style-span" style=3D"font-famil=
y: Times; ">kipToProcessorChain(getCrawlController().getPostProcessorChain(=
))</span></div>
<div><br></div><div>beware that DecideRules/Filter inserted=
 before the extraction will prevent the CrawlJob from ever getting to Uris =
that are acceptable, because the path to them goes through URIs that are no=
t.</div><div>
<br></div><div>Anas<br><div class=3D"gmail_quote">On Wed, Dec=
 23, 2009 at 1:48 AM, Steven A Rowe <span dir=3D"ltr"><<a href=3D"mailto=
:sarowe@...">sarowe@...</a>></span> wrote:<br><blockquote class=
=3D"gmail_quote" style=3D"margin:0 0 0 .8ex;border-left:1px #ccc solid;padd=
ing-left:1ex;">














<div style=3D"background-color:#fff">
<span>=
=A0</span>


<div>
  <div>


    <div>
      
      
      <p>Hi,<br>
<br>
=
I want to write decide-rules that reject resources based on two conditions:=
 content-length and content-type (e.g., text/html resources larger than 10M=
B, and text/plain resources larger than 100KB), but I can't find any wa=
y to logically AND rule subsets together.<br>

<br>
Is there a way to write=
 decide-rules that would achieve what I want?  Should I be using ScriptedDe=
cideRules?<br>
<br>
Thanks (for your patience with a newbie),<br>
Steve<br>=

<br>
</p>

    </div>

0"></div>


</div>
